ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: oil painting, mixing, how to stretch a canvas, colors
I learned a lot about mixing colors and understanding how to see what colors are actually in a painting compared to what you think you see.
Visual analysis, depth perception
I improved my observational painting skills and developed my personal style.
Introduction to oil painting, seeing light and color, and a variety of painting techniques.
I really improved my ability not only to really look at shapes and capture the lines Im observing, but also to match colors.

I learned a lot about color theory and how to be more intentional when painting (brushstrokes, color mixing/application, mediums, composition, etc.). It was really cool to take an idea and translate it into a physical work. We also had numerous workshops with other artists and learned a lot about their works and processes. Also, we had learned how to stretch our own canvases and prime them!
Painting, color, transparency
I learned so much in this class and feel that I grew immensely as a painter. I gained a much greater knowledge of color theory, basic techniques, and color mixing.

I improved a lot in terms of oil painting technique through practice. I also learned really valuable art material skills from workshops with an expert. The teacher and TF were super helpful and gave amazing feedback which helped me improve my technique, compositions, etc. I overall found that this course brought be a lot of joy and relaxation each period.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: a bit disorganized, wish we did some more smaller projects to learn more fundamental skills because diving into painting larger projects was a bit overwhelming.
I LOVED this class, Maria and Eric were the best and they were extremely helpful and encouraging.
Strengths: expectations and feedback were clear. Weakness: few opportunities to work together with peers. Didnt even know their names. Couldve been more collaborative.

Strengths: Maria and Erick were great at facilitating a comfortable class environment and were super helpful with feedback. Class was really as much as you put into it and seemed to have something everyone could engage with.
Weaknesses: The course could have a slight bit more clarity/organization on the specific day-to-day schedule. This wasn't a huge deal but definitely came up whenever I had to purchase supplies and we ended up not using them/using them way later.

I really enjoyed being free to start straight away with real painting, rather than doing endless studies. We did some practical skill-based work but were also allowed freedom to really explore, experiment and take risks. We also received such helpful, honest, kind but firm feedback.

Strengths: you are surrounded by peers who are of all artistic levels and can really learn a lot from them. the classroom environment is super open and I genuinely enjoyed coming to class everyday.

Weaknesses: this is not necessarily a weakness, but I (& many other students) often had to come in and paint outside of class hours.
I loved this course! One of my favorite ever at Yale
I really enjoyed the assignments in this courseMaria did a wonderful job of keeping us busy while not overwhelming us with work.

This course was a great place to have the freedom to explore and improve your painting skills. Since it is an intro level course, many of the students are not art majors and therefore if you're looking for more serious direction you probably won't find it here.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Maria is the best and you will learn so much, especially if you are like me and have never painted before.
yes! super fun!
Absolutely, this was my favorite course of the semester.
Yes, to beginners and art majors. Assignments rather boring for an experienced painter, but you can make it interesting for yourself.
Yes! If you have any interest in painting, taking this class is a great introduction.
100%! It was such a fantastic experience!

Yes, I would definitely recommend taking this class if you can get in! It's such a cool experience to have in undergrad and really enjoyable. Even if you don't have much experience, there is so much to learn and it's really a unique experience to be a part of Yale's art world (even if you aren't an art major).
Absolutely!
Absolutely! It was fun and so valuable. My advice is just do it!
I would definitely recommend this course if you're either interested in painting or just want to try something new in a relaxing environment where you will have the freedom to explore and improve.
